com.rambilight.core.api.Light

Class LightHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rambilight.core.api.Light.LightHandler

  • public class LightHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for handling the Lights and what to output to the ambilight device. This class is a wrapper around the lightHandlerCore and creates a manageable interface for modules to communicate by.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightHandler(java.lang.String name)
      Shouldn't ever be needed to call from within modules, but if the time comes creates a new interface for handling light output.

      • LightHandler

        public LightHandler(java.lang.String name)
        Shouldn't ever be needed to call from within modules, but if the time comes creates a new interface for handling light output.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the client. (The caller class name might be used in the future. )

    • Method Detail

      • addToUpdateBuffer

        public boolean addToUpdateBuffer(int id,
                                 int r,
                                 int g,
                                 int b)
        Add light to the update buffer. The color properties are BYTE values in INT form for easy manipulation. They should therefor be a value between 0 and 252 (The last three available bytes are reserved for the communication protocol). A higher or lower value than this be cut to 0 / 252.
        Parameters:
        id - The position of the light.
        r - The amount of red
        g - The amount of green
        b - The amount of blue
        Returns:
        true if the value was set as a new one.

      • getColorBuffer

        public Light[] getColorBuffer()
        Get the current ColorBufferObject
        Returns:
        An array containing a pointer to the current color buffer object. WARNING: Be careful when using this list, since modifying it might have unintended consequences.

      • getNumLightsToUpdate

        public int getNumLightsToUpdate()
        Get the number of lights which will be updated on the next communication cycle.
        Returns:
        number of lights

      • getSideByIndex

        public int getSideByIndex(int pos)
        Get the side which is compensated by the direction and starting position. This should be used if the plugin requires to know which side each side index corresponds to. Without this, It's a lot harder to know which side is which in all different setups.
        Parameters:
        pos - A value between zero and the number of sides which are available.
        Returns:
        The real side a static indexed side actually relates to.

      • numLights

        public int numLights()
        Get the total number of lights which are available
        Returns:
        The number of lights which are available

      • numLightsOnSide

        public int numLightsOnSide(int side)
        Get the number of lights on a specified side.
        Parameters:
        side - Light position
        Returns:
        The number of lights which are available on a specific side

      • numSides

        public int numSides()
        Get the total number of sides which are available.
        Returns:
        The number of sides which are available

      • rawAddToUpdateBuffer

        public boolean rawAddToUpdateBuffer(int id,
                                    int r,
                                    int g,
                                    int b)
        Add light to the update buffer directly. This bypasses the compression compensation.
        Parameters:
        id - Light position
        r - The amount of red
        g - The amount of green
        b - The amount of blue
        Returns:
        true if the value was set as a new one.

      • rawNumLights

        public int rawNumLights()
        Get the total number of lights which are available
        Returns:
        The number of lights which are available

      • rawNumLightsOnSide

        public int rawNumLightsOnSide(int side)
        Get the number of lights on a specified side. This bypasses the compression compensation
        Parameters:
        side - Light position
        Returns:
        The number of lights which are available on a specific side
